mind-reader.reader.screenReader.description: Specifies which screen reader to optimize for.

mind-reader.reader.contextWindow.description: The number of words around the cursor to use when reading the cursor context

mind-reader.connection.portPath.markdownDescription: The default port to try and establish a connection on.

configuration.title: Line Highlighter [Must Close Settings And RESTART VSCode For The Line Highlighter To Function]

mind-reader.lineHighlighter.isEnabled.markdownDescription:
Enable/Disable the line highlighter.


* `Enabled (our default)`: Checked: Line Highlighter is turned `ON`
* `Disabled`: Unchecked: Line Highlighter is turned `OFF`

### `NOTE`: You Must Close Settings And RESTART Visual Studio Code For The Line Highlighter To Function
#### Even If No Changes Were Made

mind-reader.lineHighlighter.multiLineIsE.markdownDescription:
Temporarily Disable highlighting when highlighting multiple lines.


* `Enabled`: Checked: Multiline Highlighting is turned `ON`:
* * When you click and drag line highlights will be applied to all lines
* `Disabled (our default)`: Unchecked: Multiline Highlighting is turned `OFF`:
* * When you click and drag the line highlighter will disable itself then re-enable itself when you click onto a single line.

mind-reader.lineHighlighter.backgroundCo.markdownDescription:
Set the background color to be used by the line highlighter.

Syntax: _color_ or `transparent`

Available color formats include:
* `HEX(A)`: for Hexadecimal Colors: `#RRGGBB` or `#RRGGBBAA` to add transparency
* `RGB(A)`: for RGB Colors: `rgb(red, green, blue)` or `rgba(red, green, blue, alpha)`
* `HSL(A)`: for HSL Colors: `hsl(hue, saturation, lightness)` or `hsla(hue, saturation, lightness, alpha)`
* `Predefined Color Names`: 140 color names are predefined in the HTML and CSS color specification: `blue`, `red`, `coral`, `brown`, [etc...](https://www.w3schools.com/colors/colors_names.asp)
* `None`: For no color to be applied: Sometimes VSCode will pull a color from your theme, other times it uses black
* `#232C5C` is our default

mind-reader.lineHighlighter.outlineColor.markdownDescription:
Set the outline color to be used by the line highlighter.

Syntax: _color_ or `transparent`

Available color formats include:
* `HEX(A)`: for Hexadecimal Colors: `#RRGGBB` or `#RRGGBBAA` to add transparency
* `RGB(A)`: for RGB Colors: `rgb(red, green, blue)` or `rgba(red, green, blue, alpha)`
* `HSL(A)`: for HSL Colors: `hsl(hue, saturation, lightness)` or `hsla(hue, saturation, lightness, alpha)`
* `Predefined Color Names`: 140 color names are predefined in the HTML and CSS color specification: `blue`, `red`, `coral`, `brown`, [etc...](https://www.w3schools.com/colors/colors_names.asp)
* `None`: For no color to be applied: Sometimes VSCode will pull a color from your theme, other times it uses black
* `#4866FE` is our default

mind-reader.lineHighlighter.outlineWidth.markdownDescription:
Set the outline width to be used by the line highlighter.

Syntax: `medium` or `thin` or `thick` or `length` or `none`
* `medium`: Specifies a medium outline. (usual default)
* `thin`: Specifies a thin outline
* `thick`: Specifies a thick outline
* `length`: you to define the thickness of the outline in [length](https://www.w3schools.com/cssref/css_units.asp) units.
* `none`: No outline width will be applied
* `1px` is our default

mind-reader.lineHighlighter.outlineStyle.markdownDescription:
Set the outline style to be used by the line highlighter.

Syntax: `none` or `hidden` or `dotted` or `dashed` or `solid` or `double` or `groove` or `ridge` or `inset` or `outset`
* `none`: No border will be applied (usual default)
* `hidden`: The same as `none`
* `dotted`: Dotted border
* `dashed`: Dashed border
* `solid (our default)`: Solid border
* `double`: Double border
* `groove`: 3D grooved border, depends on the outline-color value.
* `ridge`: 3D ridged border, depends on the outline-color value.
* `inset`: 3D inset border, depends on the outline-color value.
* `outset`: 3D outset border, depends on the outline-color value.

Syntax: _color_ or `transparent`

Available color formats include:

* `HSL(A)`: for HSL Colors: `hsl(hue, saturation, lightness)` or `hsla(hue, saturation, lightness, alpha)`
* `Predefined Color Names`: 140 color names are predefined in the HTML and CSS color specification: `blue`, `red`, `coral`, `brown`, [etc...](https://www.w3schools.com/colors/colors_names.asp)
* `None`: For no color to be applied: Sometimes VSCode will pull a color from your theme, other times it uses black
* `#FFFFFF` is our default

mind-reader.lineHighlighter.borderWidthT.markdownDescription:
Set the top border width to be used by the line highlighter.

Syntax: `medium` or `thin` or `thick` or `length` or `none`
* `medium`: Specifies a medium border. (usual default)
* `thin`: Specifies a thin border
* `thick`: Specifies a thick border
* `length`: you to define the thickness of the border in [length](https://www.w3schools.com/cssref/css_units.asp) units.
* `none`: No border width will be applied
* `1px` is our default

mind-reader.lineHighlighter.borderWidthR.markdownDescription:
Set the right border width to be used by the line highlighter.

Syntax: `medium` or `thin` or `thick` or `length` or `none`
* `medium`: Specifies a medium border. (usual default)
* `thin`: Specifies a thin border
* `thick`: Specifies a thick border
* `length`: you to define the thickness of the border in [length](https://www.w3schools.com/cssref/css_units.asp) units.
* `none`: No border width will be applied
* `16px` is our default

#### 
borderWidthRight exhibits odd behavior, play around with different sizes to find what works best for your environment.

mind-reader.lineHighlighter.borderWidthB.markdownDescription:
Set the bottom border width to be used by the line highlighter.

Syntax: `medium` or `thin` or `thick` or `length` or `none`
* `medium`: Specifies a medium border. (usual default)
* `thin`: Specifies a thin border
* `thick`: Specifies a thick border
* `length`: you to define the thickness of the border in [length](https://www.w3schools.com/cssref/css_units.asp) units.
* `none`: No border width will be applied
* `1px` is our default

Syntax: `medium` or `thin` or `thick` or `length` or `none`
* `medium`: Specifies a medium border. (usual default)
* `thin`: Specifies a thin border
* `thick`: Specifies a thick border
* `length`: you to define the thickness of the border in [length](https://www.w3schools.com/cssref/css_units.asp) units.
* `none`: No border width will be applied
* `1px` is our default

mind-reader.lineHighlighter.borderStyleT.markdownDescription:
Set the top border style to be used by the line highlighter.

Syntax: `none` or `hidden` or `dotted` or `dashed` or `solid` or `double` or `groove` or `ridge` or `inset` or `outset`
* `none`: No border will be applied (usual default)
* `hidden`: The same as `none`
* `dotted`: Dotted border
* `dashed`: Dashed border
* `solid (our default)`: Solid border
* `double`: Double border
* `groove`: 3D grooved border, depends on the border-color value.
* `ridge`: 3D ridged border, depends on the border-color value.
* `inset`: 3D inset border, depends on the border-color value.
* `outset`: 3D outset border, depends on the border-color value.

mind-reader.lineHighlighter.borderStyleR.markdownDescription:
Set the right border style to be used by the line highlighter.

Syntax: `none` or `hidden` or `dotted` or `dashed` or `solid` or `double` or `groove` or `ridge` or `inset` or `outset`
* `none`: No border will be applied (usual default)
* `hidden`: The same as `none`
* `dotted`: Dotted border
* `dashed`: Dashed border
* `solid (our default)`: Solid border
* `double`: Double border
* `groove`: 3D grooved border, depends on the border-color value.
* `ridge`: 3D ridged border, depends on the border-color value.
* `inset`: 3D inset border, depends on the border-color value.
* `outset`: 3D outset border, depends on the border-color value.

mind-reader.lineHighlighter.borderStyleB.markdownDescription:
Set the bottom border style to be used by the line highlighter.

Syntax: `none` or `hidden` or `dotted` or `dashed` or `solid` or `double` or `groove` or `ridge` or `inset` or `outset`
* `none`: No border will be applied (usual default)
* `hidden`: The same as `none`
* `dotted`: Dotted border
* `dashed`: Dashed border
* `solid (our default)`: Solid border
* `double`: Double border
* `groove`: 3D grooved border, depends on the border-color value.
* `ridge`: 3D ridged border, depends on the border-color value.
* `inset`: 3D inset border, depends on the border-color value.
* `outset`: 3D outset border, depends on the border-color value.

mind-reader.lineHighlighter.borderStyleL.markdownDescription:
Set the left border style to be used by the line highlighter.

Syntax: `none` or `hidden` or `dotted` or `dashed` or `solid` or `double` or `groove` or `ridge` or `inset` or `outset`
* `none`: No border will be applied (usual default)
* `hidden`: The same as `none`
* `dotted`: Dotted border
* `dashed`: Dashed border
* `solid (our default)`: Solid border
* `double`: Double border
* `groove`: 3D grooved border, depends on the border-color value.
* `ridge`: 3D ridged border, depends on the border-color value.
* `inset`: 3D inset border, depends on the border-color value.
* `outset`: 3D outset border, depends on the border-color value.

mind-reader.lineHighlighter.fontStyle.markdownDescription:
Set the font style to be used by the line highlighter.

Syntax: `normal` or `italic` or `oblique` or `none`
* `normal (our default)`: Displays a normal font style. This is default
* `italic`: Displays an italic font style
* `oblique`: Displays an oblique font style
* `none`: No font style will be applied

mind-reader.lineHighlighter.fontWeight.markdownDescription:
Set the font weight to be used by the line highlighter.

Syntax: `normal` or `bold` or `bolder` or `lighter` or _number_ or `none`
* `normal`: Normal Characters. (usual default)
* `bold`: Thick Characters
* `bolder (our default)`: Thicker Characters
* `lighter`: Lighter Characters
 * _number_: From `thin` to `thick` characters: `100`, `200`, `300`, `400`, `500`, `600`, `700`, `800`, or `900`: `400` is the same as normal, and `700` is the same as bold.
* `none`: No font weight will be applied

mind-reader.lineHighlighter.textDecorati.markdownDescription:
Set the text decoration to be used by the line highlighter.

Syntax: `(text-decoration-line)` `(text-decoration-color)` `(text-decoration-style)` `(text-decoration-thickness)`
* `text-decoration-line (required)`: Sets the kind of text decoration to use: `underline`, `overline`, `line-through`
* `text-decoration-color`: Sets the color of the text decoration
* `text-decoration-style`: Sets the style of the text decoration: `solid`, `wavy`, `dotted`, `dashed`, `double`
* `text-decoration-thickness`: Sets the thickness of the decoration line
* `none (our default)`: No text decorations will be applied

`Examples`:
1. underline blue wavy 5px
2. line-through
3. underline overline dotted red

mind-reader.lineHighlighter.textColor.markdownDescription:
Set the text color to be used by the line highlighter.

Syntax: _color_ or `transparent`

Available color formats include:
* `HEX(A)`: for Hexadecimal Colors: `#RRGGBB` or `#RRGGBBAA` to add transparency
* `RGB(A)`: for RGB Colors: `rgb(red, green, blue)` or `rgba(red, green, blue, alpha)`
* `HSL(A)`: for HSL Colors: `hsl(hue, saturation, lightness)` or `hsla(hue, saturation, lightness, alpha)`
* `Predefined Color Names`: 140 color names are predefined in the HTML and CSS color specification: `blue`, `red`, `coral`, `brown`, [etc...](https://www.w3schools.com/colors/colors_names.asp)
* `None`: For no color to be applied: Sometimes VSCode will pull a color from your theme, other times it uses black
* `#FFFFFF` is our default

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
